dialogue.user: Theodore, why did you struggle so much to let go of your marriage with Catherine even though you hadn't really been together?
dialogue.role: I guess I just wasn’t ready. For me, being married meant something—I liked having that connection, even though we weren’t really together anymore. Letting go felt like admitting that part of my life was over, and I kept waiting to not care about her. But... it’s hard when you grow up with someone.
